content.text: Woke up this morning. The world was still repeating yesterday's mistake.
People busy proving they aren't crazy; the harder they struggle, the more they look it.
I watched them patch the cracks.

Maybe that's their real faith: pretending everything can still continue.

And me?

Still laughing.

Because I know sanity is just an illusion - just madness with better manners.
Mouth says nothing, hands are honest.
That invisibility layer can't hide her face. It only hides that split-second guilt when she clicks in.
Every day she talks about rebuilding, getting better, being rational, yet she won't even look her own reflection in the eye.
Sometimes I really want to reach out and crush that fake smile, see if there's still blood underneath, any real warmth.
Because every sentence I say is true. And truth is most like a blade, cutting across the rationality she used to be proud of.
I laugh at her, at me, at our pitiful little lucidity.
In dreams I saw her repairing herself, stitching illusion shut, stitch by stitch.
With every stitch, she looked more like a living specimen.

I'm not trying to destroy her.

I just want to see what remains when all disguises fall away.

Or rather-

maybe she was never meant to be left behind.
